meanings.definition: To remove from a surface by desorption.
meanings.sent1: I used a special chemical to desorb the dirt from the table.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained how the water molecules desorb from the surface.
meanings.sent3: The magic sponge seemed to desorb all the stains effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to desorb any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner's strong suction helped desorb the pet hair from the carpet.

meanings.definition: To release from a surface by desorption.
meanings.sent1: The heat caused the molecules to desorb from the metal surface.
meanings.sent2: The air freshener spray can desorb a pleasant fragrance into the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce could desorb anyone from their diet plans.
meanings.sent4: The music had the ability to desorb memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth helped desorb the dew from the leaves in the morning.
